alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 8:21PM EST until February 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Scioto River at Piketon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River at Piketon. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Backwater flooding worsens along creeks flowing into the Scioto River. Stretches of several low-lying roads near the river are flooded. Scioto and Camp Creek Townships in southern Pike County experience the most significant flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Monday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage Saturday morning to 19.2 feet and then begin rising early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late Tuesday evening to 22.6 feet Thursday morning. It will fall below flood stage again Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
